did.head: Collection Summary

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Arizona. District Court (1st Judicial District, Pima County)

did.abstract: James Levy was a gunfighter and gambler; killed in 1882 at Tucson, Ariz., as a result of a feud with John Murphy, a Tucson gambler. Collection includes a holograph copy of files and records concerning an 1885 murder trial held in Pinal County. The defendants, David Gibson and William Moyer, were accused of murdering James Levy, in 1882 at Tucson, Ariz.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.p: Territory of Arizona vs. ...David Gibson (AZ 137). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: James Levy was a gunfighter and gambler; killed in 1882 at Tucson, Ariz., as a result of a feud with John Murphy, a Tucson gambler.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized in chronological arrangement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: A holograph copy of files and records concerning an 1885 murder trial held in Pinal County. The defendants, David Gibson and William Moyer, were accused of murder of James Levy, in 1882 at Tucson, Ariz.
